text: DUBAI, Dec 12 Saudi Arabia said on Sunday it was planning 171 billion riyal ($45.58 billion) in military spending in 2022, down 10.2% from estimated spending of 190 billion in 2021, according to the kingdoms budget statement.The kingdom said it spent 201 billion riyal on its armed forces in 2020, the document showed, a sign that the cost of the military conflict in neighbouring Yemen has started to ease. ($1 = 3.7513 riyals) (Reporting by Aziz El Yaakoubi, Editing by William Maclean)
